channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Angry' Donald Trump calls NYT over helicopter fact check: 'Yes, he was in a scary ride'
item.description: The New York Times Saturday published a report confirming that Donald Trump was indeed on a rocky helicopter ride as he earlier claimed. But it was not with Willie Brown, the former San Francisco mayor, Kamala Harris' ex-boyfriend as Trump claimed in his press conference Thursday. On Friday, NYT said the 'jaw-dropping story' that Trump told about nearly dying in a helicopter ride actually never happened.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea launches more trash balloons towards South Korea: Seoul military
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump plays Kamala Harris' 'tough and bit*h' video at Montana rally: 'We are not weird'
item.description: If you listen to Kamala Harris' speech, you would not know that she has been running the country for four years, Donald Trump said at his Montana rally and then played a compilation of Kamala Harris' statements known as 'word salads'. The Montana rally Friday marked Donald Trump's return to the campaign after he took a hiatus and then addressed a press conference at his home Thursday,.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: No, Tim Walz didn't carry weapons in war; Yes, he misspoke: Harris campaign clarifies
item.description: Amid the ongoing controversy over Tim Walz's military record, whether he opted out of the service just before his unit's deployment in Iraq, the Harris-Walz campaign took a step back and admitted that yes, Tim Walz "misspoke" when he talked about carrying weapons in war -- in 2018. The video resurfaced after Walz's rival Ohio senator JD Vance called Walz's military record as "stolen valor" and that he never went to war.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sierra Leone court sentences soldiers to long jail terms for failed coup
item.description: The sentences were read out in court late on Friday with the judge handing out prison terms ranging from 50 and 120 years on those convicted.

item.title: Bangladesh crisis: Why protesting students forced Chief Justice to resign
item.description: "I feel it is necessary to share a special news with you. Our chief justice has resigned a few minutes back. His resignation letter has already reached the law ministry. We will send it to the president without delay for taking necessary measures," Asif Nazrul, law, justice and parliamentary affairs adviser to the interim government, said.​​
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: King Charles praises 'community spirit' in call for unity after UK's violent riots
item.description: King Charles III praised peaceful counter-protesters for their community spirit after far-right riots led to over 700 arrests. The riots followed a stabbing attack in Southport. In calls with PM Keir Starmer and police chiefs, the King expressed his gratitude to emergency services and hoped for unity based on mutual respect.

item.title: 'I can't even say ... ': Joe Biden on why he quit US presidential race
item.description: Joe Biden discussed his decision to withdraw from the presidential race in his first interview post-quitting. He emphasized the importance of defeating Donald Trump and unifying the Democratic Party. Biden's withdrawal followed a lackluster debate performance. He expressed concerns about Trump's potential reaction to losing, showing support for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz's campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Minorities faced 205 attacks after fall of Hasina-govt in Bangladesh: Hindu groups
item.description: Following the fall of Sheikh Hasina's government, Bangladesh has witnessed at least 205 attacks on minority communities in 52 districts. Hindu organizations have called on interim leader Muhammad Yunus to address the violence. Over 230 people have been killed, with numerous Hindu temples, homes, and businesses vandalized, escalating fears and uncertainties among minorities.

item.title: 'Potential sales restrictions on way': Japanese authorities warn people against hoarding as megaquake fears surge
item.description: Tokyo residents faced shortages of essential items as quake fears sparked a rush for disaster supplies. The government urged citizens to avoid panic buying. Demand surged after a 7.1-magnitude quake hit Japan's southern coast, and a 5.3 tremor near Tokyo caused further concern. Retailers reported high demand for disaster kits and daily necessities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Wolf in sheep's clothing': Tim Walz’s 2022 gubernatorial opponent slams him
item.description: Former Minnesota Republican gubernatorial candidate Dr Scott Jensen criticized Democratic Vice President nominee Tim Walz as manipulative and unreliable. Jensen claimed Walz often fails to honor debate promises, citing the 2022 Minnesota gubernatorial race where expected statewide televised debates didn't occur, despite Walz's earlier assurances. Jensen warned Ohio Senator JD Vance about Walz's political strategies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince William and Kate 'disgusted' as prince Harry inherits $8.5m amid ongoing family feud: Report
item.description: Prince William and Kate Middleton felt disgusted as Prince Harry was set to receive an $8.5 million inheritance upon turning 40. The windfall from a trust fund established by Queen Elizabeth II intensified tensions within the royal family, particularly given Harry's recent withdrawal from royal duties and public criticism of the family.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brazil plane crash: How passenger no. 58 dodged death
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: New York City experiences light rain and winds as Debby moves towards Northeastern America
item.description: Northern Pennsylvania and Southern New York experienced flash floods due to Tropical Storm Debby, which initially hit Florida’s Gulf Coast as a category 1 hurricane. Officials ordered evacuations in parts of Pennsylvania, but some were lifted by evening. The storm caused disruptions, including flight delays, but New York City saw diminished rainfall impact compared to other regions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US intel: Did share info to foil alleged IS plot targeting Taylor Swift Concert
item.description: US intelligence aided in thwarting a planned attack by Islamic State sympathizers at a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna. Three individuals were arrested and charged with planning a suicide attack. This successful intervention emphasised the importance of international cooperation in combating terrorism and safeguarding public events, as confirmed by the White House.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Prince Harry thought King Charles would forgive him but ...': Expert
item.description: Prince Harry expected his father, King Charles, to make amends and forgive him, but tensions have instead heightened. Since Harry's departure from royal duties and his revealing memoir, Charles is reportedly furious and refuses to take his son's calls. The King is also concerned about potential future revelations from Meghan Markle.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why are scientists proposing to warm up Mars, how will they do it?
item.description: Scientists proposed to introduce engineered nanoparticles into Mars' atmosphere to raise its temperature by 50 degrees Fahrenheit over ten years. These particles would enhance the natural greenhouse effect. The researchers believe warming Mars' atmosphere is a crucial step despite the planet's harsh conditions. They also stress the importance of studying potential unintended consequences, including the possibility of past or present life on Mars.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Watch: Female NYPD officer punched on face by 'repeat offender' at New York sidewalk
item.description: A female NYPD officer was assaulted by Ernst Delma, a repeat offender, on a Bronx sidewalk. The attack happened when the officer intervened in Delma's argument with children. She received facial injuries and was taken to the hospital. Delma was arrested and has a history of similar offenses. The incident raised concerns about criminal justice priorities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK govt mulls curbs on visas for techies to bring down migration
item.description: The UK government considered tightening visa rules for foreign IT, telecom, and engineering professionals to address high migration levels. Home Secretary Yvette Cooper requested a review by the Migration Advisory Committee, focusing on sectors heavily reliant on international recruitment due to domestic skill shortages. The report is expected in nine months.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: ‘No excuses’: US & other mediators call on Israel, Hamas to talk truce on Aug 15
item.description: Leaders from the US, Egypt, and Qatar urged Israel and Hamas to resume talks on the Gaza conflict, emphasizing that only details of the ceasefire and hostage release need finalizing. Israeli PM Netanyahu announced that Israel's negotiation team will meet on August 15 to finalize the agreement details. Four or five areas of disagreement remain unresolved.
